Love at first crumb.

Fill your table with friends, family, neighbors—and fresh handmade bread.

Convivial bread is naturally leavened, hand-crafted bread made with local grains in Green Bay, Wisconsin, baked to create conviviality at your table.

Real Bread

Long, flavor-building fermentation

Each loaf of bread takes 18-24 hours to make from beginning to end.

Hand-crafted

No mixers, shapers, dividers, or machines are used on the dough.

No additives

Our dough is made with flour, water, salt, and natural wild yeast.

Wisconsin grains

We use 100% local, Wisconsin-grown organic or eco-friendly, chemical-free grain.

Our mission is to help communities grow, learn, and thrive through local food care, curiosity, and creativity.

A community of care

When we experience care, we feel a sense of wholeness. Food created with care and enjoyed with good company is just as essential to health as any specific nutrient.

Fermenting curiosity

Taste is a way to explore curiosity and new possibilities. The root of learning is curiosity and there's a whole world of taste to explore.

Local food creativity

Through collaborations with local farmers and a supportive community we can create and celebrate our unique, creative, and sustainable local food identity.

Creating Conviviality

Conviviality is a friendly, lively atmosphere. The word comes from the Latin convivium, meaning “a feast”, which comes from con- “with” + vivere “live.”

An atmosphere of conviviality accompanied by local food is a key characteristic of both "blue zones", areas of the world with a high number of centenarians, and "third places", gathering places away from work and home that are essential to building strong, creative communities.
